memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Then Isaac sowed in that land, and reaped in the same year a hundredfold; and the Lord blessed him. The man began to prosper, and continued prospering until he became very prosperous.” (Genesis 26:12–13 (NKJV)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Isaac’s story in the land of the Philistines reveals the beauty of faith-filled obedience. Though the place was filled with fear and hostility, Isaac stayed because God commanded him to. He believed the Lord’s promise of protection and provision. While others withheld, Isaac sowed his seed in faith  in a dry, barren, and unfriendly land. God honored his obedience by changing even the heart of Abimelech, who protected Isaac and his household. The miracle followed: in the same year, Isaac reaped a hundredfold harvest. His prosperity did not stop  it continued until he became very prosperous.

When faith and obedience meet, God releases continuous blessings. Hardship may seem like a wilderness, but faith turns the dry ground into fruitfulness. The God of Isaac is our God too. Let us sow in faith, even when surrounded by strife or uncertainty. Our God sees, rewards, and multiplies. No hard work done in faith will ever remain barren.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “Faith is not believing that God can, but knowing that He will.”- Corrie ten Boom

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, help me to obey You even in fearful places. Teach me to sow in faith and trust in Your promise of blessing. Let my obedience bring forth a hundredfold harvest for Your glory. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May your faith break every fear, and may your obedience open rivers in dry lands. The God who prospered Isaac will prosper you continually!
